caption: My son loved it and that's all that matters! They are open on Saturday afternoon and there is not always a crowd which means that we got quite a lot of attention from the very friendly staff. My son spent a lot of time driving the miniature trains and the staff was very understanding
I visited with my 3 years old son. The ppl are nice and spent time to give some explanation to the kids.
No prior indication. it was closed when I showed up at the given times
Great place to experience the history of French trains

We had a great time as a family with 2 little men aged 2.5 years who are passionate about trains. Very well received by enthusiasts who showed us the beautiful miniature circuit and real cabins. Advice for families

Very nice museum, run by enthusiasts who like to pass on their experience as railway workers and involve visitors in demonstrations. There is something for everyone, those who like the scale model as well as those who like the full-size models. I really recommend the visit.

Interesting little museum which tells the history of the railway in France. With old objects and materials from the time. A beautiful model with a train circuit. Adult entry is 5 euros, however by car it is difficult to park and it is paying on public roads.
Museum suitable for children.  Enthusiasts share their experiences and passion for rail. Nice visit to do with the family
Superb experience, the museum staff are passionate and explained a lot to us about the railway world, it was a superb museum THANKS !
Great museum and great welcome! Thank you so much.

A warm welcome, a small, informative museum, on the other hand with a life-size driving cabin in one room - wow! ðŸ˜€ and a large miniature train circuit in another room.....there is plenty of fun for adults and Lilliputians alike! ðŸ˜„  P.S. the museum also sells magnificent retro and artistic posters and postcards

A small, unpretentious museum, but a great immersive experience in the world of trains. You can visit a cockpit and see a reconstruction of an old cockpit. The youngest can even learn to pilot on a model. The explanations of the enthusiasts who run this place are very rich. Something to delight young and old alike!
Very interesting museum, very friendly staff. Many reconstructions. Really worth doing if you are curious and like trains in general.
A beautiful museum, certainly not very large premises, but volunteers who know how to take the time to show you around. I advise, if in service (inquire before), to take a lory ride.

A high quality museum due to the diversity of the material on display, the detail of the reconstructions of materials, the explanations and the activities. Above all, a big thank you to the team of enthusiasts who run this place for their welcome, their availability, their competence and their very interesting and very precise explanations - in particular on the operation in the reconstructed cabin of an A1A A1A 68500 diesel-electric locomotive and a reversible trainset - which know how to adapt to both adults and children.
Great visit. Good welcome. Passionate volunteers who are never stingy with explanations. Activities suitable for young people. Very realistic reconstruction of locomotive cabins.

The 2 people who tour us are passionate and explain very interesting things to us. I will return there with my son. He, who is passionate about trains, really enjoyed getting into 2 real locomotives and driving the train circuits. THANKS

This museum is really very interesting, the guides are really very involved, they give very clear and interesting explanations. My 5-year-old son was also delighted to be able to guide the model. The museum deserves to be bigger!

Very interesting visit even if the museum is not very big (we still easily spent 1 to 1.5 hours there). The fact that it is former railway workers who are passionate about trains who run this museum is a real plus.

A visit decided somewhat randomly on a rainy day, and upon arrival a very nice surprise. Thanks to Yves, a passionate talker and teacher, for all his explanations as well as for his strong opinions on the SNCF in these times when it is easily questioned.
Thank you for this superb visit

Another small museum that you have to look for, it is located under the sales office of Rosny sous Bois station but very well served by the RER E. The different rooms present a theme such as high-speed rail, signaling and switches but also a reconstructed train cabin. The museum is open on Saturday afternoons and during national events, shop where you can find books and objects relating to the railway world.

Interesting museum with passionate volunteers who brilliantly maintain their installations and who know how to innovate to create unique spaces (who would have thought that you could control a miniature train with an authentic console and even a mini on-board camera!).
Great as a museum. You are entitled to train driving demonstrations, models of different trains over the years, assembled circuits, videos and explanations from specialists. We loved going there.
Very pretty museum run by passionate retirees but unfortunately not very educational or comfortable with children, which is a shame.

Funny but not really great. Staff unfriendly even though I still speak French. When I bought something in the shop, I accidentally received 10 euros too little back (he had secretly kept the 10 euros for himself)
Great place. Visited with a 7 year old boy who has been passionate about trains since he was little. Very well explained visit. Very warm welcome from enthusiasts.
It is a very interesting museum for people who like the SNCF network. I liked it, the staff is very friendly.
Superb place to discover under the Rosny sous bois station. Great for young and old train enthusiasts alike. We drive a miniature train on a long route using the mechanism of an old locomotive!
Great museum, the guides are very involved and you can immediately see that they are passionate, the explanations given are very precise. We had a very good visit
Museum of great richness and passionate speakers who gave us a great visit
A museum to see even with children because enthusiasts are available for any explanations. To recommend.
Museum managed by enthusiasts. Exciting for parents and children alike. The guide was fantastic and taught us so many things
A place for enthusiasts, a very friendly visit and lots of things to learn and discover (and even handle for children). Thanks to the team and congratulations for this place!
Great for train lovers. The people at the museum are passionate people who share their passion with great pleasure.
Museum open and maintained by enthusiasts. The staff is warm and welcoming, with particular patience towards children!
Very pleasant visit with Alain in particular, a great enthusiast who taught my son many things. Thanks to the volunteer team
Great place on the history of the train, free for children and only 5th for adults. Passionate staff.
